intro: Commelina vilavelhensis, commonly known as the Madagascar spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
